Interface DifficultyStrategy

All Known Implementing Classes:
DemoDifficulty, EasyDifficulty, HardDifficulty, NormalDifficulty
public interface DifficultyStrategy
Week 12-02: DifficultyStrategy Interface (STRATEGY PATTERN SOLUTION) ✅ SOLUTION: Define strategy interface for difficulty behaviors Benefits of Strategy Pattern: 1. Open/Closed Principle: Add new difficulties without modifying existing code 2. Single Responsibility: Each difficulty encapsulates its own logic 3. Compile-time Safety: No string comparisons! 4. Easy to Test: Each strategy can be tested independently 5. Flexible: Can swap strategies at runtime (if needed) Contrast with Week 12-01 Anti-Pattern: ❌ Before: switch(difficulty) scattered across multiple files ✅ Now: Each difficulty is a separate class implementing this interface

  • Method Details

    • getSpawnInterval

      float getSpawnInterval()
      Get the spawn interval for this difficulty
      Returns:
      Time in seconds between spawns

    • getInitialSpikeCount

      int getInitialSpikeCount()
      Get the number of Spikes to spawn initially

    • getInitialGoblinCount

      int getInitialGoblinCount()
      Get the number of Goblins to spawn initially

    • getInitialWolfCount

      int getInitialWolfCount()
      Get the number of Wolves to spawn initially

    • hasContinuousSpawning

      boolean hasContinuousSpawning()
      Should this difficulty have continuous spawning during gameplay?
      Returns:
      true if enemies should auto-spawn, false otherwise

    • getEnemyTypeToSpawn

      int getEnemyTypeToSpawn(int random)
      Get the enemy type to spawn (0=Spike, 1=Goblin, 2=Wolf)
      Parameters:
      random - Random number (0-9) for probability distribution
      Returns:
      Enemy type index: 0 (Spike), 1 (Goblin), 2 (Wolf), or -1 (no wolves)

    • getName

      String getName()
      Get the display name of this difficulty
